messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] GED  follow-up
messages.msgSnippet: ... My mother got her GED (in Oregon) many years ago many years after having quit school in Atlanta. My sister (the one I had custody of ) got her GED (in
messages.messageBody:
--- Betsy Hill <ecsamhill@...> wrote:
> >Both of my parents received their GED / diploma in
> Michigan and I don't
> think
> >it was the same there (but this was also in the
> 60's). But the piece of
> paper
> >meant nothing to them and neither had kept it. My
> father is a warehouse
> >worker but my mother got a good government job and
> makes an insanely high
> >salary with her GED.
>
> My brother's a computer programmer who left high
> school early with a GED.
> He says he wouldn't do it again, because it had a
> negative impact on his
> social life. <g> Apparently the young women at the
> Jr. College won't date
> you if you are a couple of years younger than they
> are! (At least, that
> was his experience.)
>
> Betsy


My mother got her GED (in Oregon) many years ago many
years after having quit school in Atlanta. My sister
(the one I had custody of ) got her GED (in Florida)
She now has a MS in Library Science, BA in Design, is
a librarian, has 3 beautiful gifted young adult
children....and is JUST BEAUTIFUL in every way. She
did get married and have a child at 17. My brother
got his GED (In Alabama)after serving in the Marines
during the Vietnam "Conflict" . He is an EMT now. None
of them were pregnant (at the time..ha!) or criminals.


Sharon

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] RE: [Unschooling-dotcom} GED and fear,  some comments
messages.msgSnippet: ... think ... paper ... My brother s a computer programmer who left high school early with a GED. He says he wouldn t do it again, because it had a negative
messages.messageBody:
>Both of my parents received their GED / diploma in Michigan and I don't
think
>it was the same there (but this was also in the 60's). But the piece of
paper
>meant nothing to them and neither had kept it. My father is a warehouse
>worker but my mother got a good government job and makes an insanely high
>salary with her GED.

My brother's a computer programmer who left high school early with a GED.
He says he wouldn't do it again, because it had a negative impact on his
social life. <g> Apparently the young women at the Jr. College won't date
you if you are a couple of years younger than they are! (At least, that
was his experience.)

Betsy
